column6: The indicative terms provided are based on the information provided, the following assumptions and subject to Credit committee approval
The Borrower has a clean credit history, is an experienced landlord and is a UK national or limited company
The property is a residential unit intended for occupancy by a single household
The valuation figure provided reflects the 180-day market value of the property in its current condition

column5: If any of these assumptions do not apply, the indicative terms provided may need to be revised to comply with our lending policy.

The following list comprises the standard information required for underwriting purposes. Note that further information may be requested during the underwriting process depending on the nature of the transaction, specific circumstances of the borrower and the type of property.

column6: Confirmation of your proc fee payment route (Mortgage Club, Network, Packager or other).
Asset and Liability Statement for any individual Borrowers, Shareholders or Guarantors (Blank form attached for your ease)
Signed Decision in Principle ("DIP")
Name of the borrowing entity
Main residential address for the borrower (individual) or key principal / shareholder (companies) - covers 3 years history
Contact details for the borrower (name, email, phone no.) and person providing access to the property for valuation
Proof of identity for individual borrowers, guarantors or shareholders >25%: passport or internationally accepted document
Proof of address for individual borrowers, guarantors or shareholders >25%: bank staement or utility bill dated within the last 3 months
column17: Required for test that loan is for business purposes and non-regulated, max personal use 40% of [net/gross] loan

column6: Details of the borrower's solicitor (Law Society registered firm with at least 2 SRA regulated partners, sole conveyancing practices not accepted)
column17: Get the explanation first and then request specific evidence, refer to TL / Head if unsure or have any concerns

column6: Completed and signed direct debit mandate
column17: Can remove if no deposit / shortfall required from borrower

column6: Purpose of loan (purchase / refinance / capital raise)
Proposed exit strategy / source of repayment
Breakdown of use of funds (including cost estimate for any proposed works)
Explanation of the borrower's source of wealth (i.e. income from employment, investment, inheritance, capital appreciation of assets)
Confirmation of the source of funds for the transaction
Supporting evidence for the source of funds for the transaction
Redemption statement from the existing lender/s (if refinance)
Copy of the purchase contract (if purchase)
Confirmation of which product and fee range your client would like to proceed with
Confirmation of borrower's occupation (employed) or business activities (self-employed) and estimated income
column17: To confirm if higher rate taxpayer or FTB to confirm minimum income £30,000

column6: Proof of income: three months payslips or bank statements (employed) or latest two years SA302 / tax calculations (self-employed)
Certificate of incorporation (UK corporate), trust deed (UK trust) or equivalent incorporation documents (overseas entities)
Last two years financial accounts and most recent management accounts
Property particulars: address, type (HMO, MUFB, Holiday Let etc), planning use, tenure, leasehold term (if applicable)
Confirmation the size of each individual unit is 30 sqm or more
Confirmation if the property is currently tenanted or vacant
Property specifications: internal area and no bedrooms by unit, condition, communal areas, outside space, parking
Tenancy schedule detailing tenancy status, monthly rental and lease termination dates by unit
Copies of all leases (including commercial and ASTs) relating to the property
Schedule of works and costing where any refurbishment or remediation works are proposed
Breakdown of unit types (residential, office, retail etc.)
Confirmation of planning use for each unit
Breakdown of value and rental income (forecast or actual if tenanted) by individual unit
Number of bedrooms and communal areas
Room size of each bedroom, kitchen and any other communal areas
Evidence the property has the correct planning use to be operated as an HMO and meets Local Authority requirements
Where applicable an HMO licence is to be in place prior to completion
Details of Borrower's previous experience of managing holiday lets and track record
Evidence the property has the correct planning use to be operated as a holiday let
Copies of last 12 months' bank statements (if available) evidencing rental received
12 month rental forecast (to be verified via valuer / estate agents at a later stage)
High, medium and low season rental income figures (lending based on average confirmed by valuer at 30 weeks occupancy)
Forecast achievable rental amount based on a single AST letting

column17: If you want to add additional information, please select Yes

column6: Use this section for any additional AML items for Med / High risk (e.g. second Proof of address)
Use this section if bank statements are required specifically to verify receipt of rental income
